title: FIB: Design requirements for Infrastructure Order (Q2/25)
description:
Description
The location management has been the 1st  of the FIB tool capabilities. The Infrastruture order is a second capability, for which FIB needs to create some prerequisites. 
The next implementation steps will be:
For locations in FTTH Status "Ready":
place an order to request the initial construction of a GFTA via FIO (TMF641) 
For locations in FTTH status "Connected":
Define workflow for existing GFTAs 
For these steps the following prerequisites need to be created in this epic: 
Clarify workflow for extisting GFTAs, UX design (current state: user can add this manually)  -> Mark 
Get to know TMF641, clarify prerequisites for sending data to FIO (technically) -> Aleksei
Clarify response from TMF641 (are they able to send back the GFTA [GFID] later, as an event?) -> Aleksei 
check impact of TMF641 responses on existing process (ChangeLog, automated Preorder interface) -> Thomas, Patricia 
Clarify prerequisits for sending data to FIO (business) --> Thomas  
Enhance UX design with the process to send data to FIO when the status is "Ready", use of field "Order placed" -> Mark 
Impact/ prerequisites to enhance Roles and Rights  for sending data to FIO --> Thomas, Carsten 
  ______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
General Description:
The "FIB Tool" (FTTH Infrastructure Building) has the target to support the provisioning of FTTH infrastructure for large enterprise customers. Its aim is to provide the status of fiber availability for different locations to the user who can then offer fiber to his/her customer for these locations. 
The FIB tool will be integrated with the Integrated offer (B2BOC), but also provide an interface definition and API to be integrated to other Offering Tools within Deutsche Telekom Geschäftskunden (such as FLAMINGO ...). 
In order to pursue the strategy for B2BOC to replace SAPCPQ as PANDA offer application, the FIB tool will be a new microservice application that substitute s the SAPCPQ internal Locations Functionality.
In this epic the requirements for the FIB tool itself are described on basis of the existing locations functionality. 
For the Roadmap refer to https://wiki.telekom.de/x/cwCTkQ. Task of this epic is to describe and prepare the implementation planned for Q1/25.

  Guardrails for FIB Tool targets: 
FIB is a project management / rollout management tool with a focus on address and location mgmt for larger customers/many locations
FIB integrates into the existing application landscape and does not replace it (shell be possible to integrate from many systems, FLAMINGO, customer portal, Salesforce etc.)  --> clarify who (user) is allowed to use the interface with what data (which AGP number o.ä., restrictions) 
  Planned Process for the FIB-Tool: 
1: request fiber availability status  
2: Entry in technik database of interested parties
3: Order removal, comply with HTN if necessary
4: Order additional GT-TAs if necessary
5: Order notifications/updates
